meanings.definition: To keep someone in official custody, typically for questioning or investigation.
meanings.sent1: The police were detaining the suspect for questioning.
meanings.sent2: The security guard was detaining the shoplifter until the authorities arrived.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was detaining the toy mouse in its paws.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to be detaining the moment, stretching it out endlessly.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds detaining the sunlight, casting a shadow over the town.

meanings.definition: To prevent someone from leaving a place.
meanings.sent1: The locked gate was detaining the students inside the school.
meanings.sent2: The heavy snow was detaining travelers at the airport.
meanings.sent3: The broken elevator was detaining people on the top floor.
meanings.sent4: Fear was detaining her from stepping outside her comfort zone.
meanings.sent5: The magical barrier detaining the princess in the tower.

meanings.sent1: The traffic jam was detaining the commuters on their way to work.
meanings.sent2: The technical issue was detaining the start of the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected phone call was detaining him from leaving the office.
meanings.sent4: His doubts were detaining him from making a decision.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog detaining the arrival of the ship at the harbor.
